dc:description: LDB3 was first reported in relation to autosomal dominant dilated cardiomyopathy in 2003 (Vatta et al, PMID: 4662268). LDB3 was originally evaluated for DCM by the ClinGen DCM GCEP on May 22, 2020. Evidence of the association of this gene with DCM was re-evaluated using SOP v10 on March 21, 2025. As a result, the classification did not change. A summary of the information contributing to the classification of this gene at the time of re-evaluation is summarized herein. In addition to DCM, LDB3 has also been reported with myofibrillar myopathy at the time of review. This was considered in accordance with ClinGen lumping and splitting criteria. Due to the distinct differences in phenotypic variability the curation was split and curated for AD DCM. LDB3 has also been curated by the ClinGen DCM GCEP for AR DCM. Human genetic evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data. At least 7 unique missense variants have been reported in humans (Vatta et al, 2004, PMID: 4662268; Arimura et al, 2004, PMID: 14660611; Xing et al, 2006, PMID: 16427346). However, the majority of these variants were not assigned points due to high population frequencies in gnomAD or lack of functional data to support pathogenicity. Points were awarded to two de novo variants: p.Lys136Met and p.Thr213Ile (Vatta et al, PMID: 4662268). In addition, this gene-disease assertion is supported by expression studies, in vitro functional assays, protein interaction studies, and rescue in animal models. It has been well established LDB3 is expressed in the heart (Faulkner et al, 1999, PMID: 10427098, Zhou et al, 1999, PMID: 10391924, Huang et al, 2004, PMID: 12499364, Vatta et al, 2004, PMID: 4662268). Protein interaction studies show LDB3 interacts with ACTN2 (Faulker et al, 1999, PMID: 10427098, Zhou et al, 1999 PMID: 10391924, Zheng et al, 2009, PMID: 19028670, Zhou et al, 2001, PMID: 11696561) and TNNI3 (Lv et al, 2021, PMID: 34966794). Zebrafish and mouse animal rescue models showed injection of Cypher resulted in at least a partial rescue of the phenotype (Huang et al, 2004 PMID: 12499364, Van de Meer et al, 2006, PMID: 16982050). In summary, there is limited evidence to support this gene-disease relationship. More evidence is needed to support the relationship of LDB3 with AD DCM. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Dilated Cardiomyopathy Working Group on March 21, 2025 (SOP Version 10).
curationReasonDescription: While there are multiple animal models indicating knockout of Cypher results in a DCM phenotype, the animal models are knockouts of the protein in contrast to human data which is associated with a heterozygous phenotype. Therefore,  given the limitation with the animal models along with the limited amount of case-level evidence, we have modified the classification to "Limited."

evidence.dc:description: global quantitative phosphoproteomic analysis revealed phosphorylation of troponin I 23/24ser
evidence.rdfs:label: Troponin I interaction

evidence.dc:description: In vivo immunoprecipitation of Cypher with calsarcin-1 and myotilin showing the interaction of Cypher with calsarcin-1 and myotilin through its PDZ domain
evidence.rdfs:label: immunoprecipitation MYOZ2 and MYOT

evidence.dc:description: Yeast two hybrid screen found 23 clones with fragments of the ACTN2 gene. The only other seven clones were false positives (mitochondrial genes and transcription factors).
evidence.rdfs:label: Yeast two hybrid screen ACTN2

evidence.dc:description: The authors used both semi-quantitative RT-PCR and whole mount in situ hybridization to analyze where Cypher is expressed in zebrafish. Cypher was expressed in heart and skeletal tissue.
evidence.rdfs:label: Zebrafish Expression

evidence.dc:description: Northern blot from human heart cells confirms expression of exons 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 10.
evidence.rdfs:label: Isoform expression in the human heart

evidence.dc:description: Protein Kinase C is not a definitively associated protein with DCM
A yeast two-hybrid screen showed binding affinity between protein kinase C (alpha, epsilon, and zeta) and LDB3.
evidence.rdfs:label: Hybrid Screen Protein Kinase C

evidence.dc:description:
The authors introduced mutations within the PDZ domain via PCR-based mutagenesis.
"Mutant PDZ domains, and a control wild-type PDZ domain were fused to GST, and pull-down assays were performed to evaluate the interaction between mutant PDZ domains and -actinin 2. Mutation of either L76 or L80 to K significantly reduced binding of the Cypher PDZ domain to - actinin 2, and mutation of L78 to K completely abolished the binding." 

For part 2, the authors introduced mutations into the EF hands of ACTN2. "Results from GST pull down assays demonstrated that EF3–4, containing the last two EF hands, retained the ability to bind to the PDZ domain, whereas EF1–2, lacking the last two EF hands, 4EF-del3, and -actinin 2-del3, lacking only the last three amino acids, no longer bound the PDZ domain."
evidence.rdfs:label: Pull down Assay Cypher and ACTN2

evidence.dc:description: Protein Kinase C has not been definitively associated with DCM
coimmunoprecipitation of two cypher isoforms , one with the LIM domain and one without, with the protein kinase C isoforms revealed the LIM domain binds with protein kinase C.
evidence.rdfs:label: PRKC binds with LIM domain

evidence.dc:description: A co-IP assay confirmed interaction between PGM1 and ZASP/Cypher. Western blot analysis indicates binding with exon 4 in wild type cells.
evidence.rdfs:label: Immunoprecipitation Cypher/ZASP and PGM1

evidence.dc:description: The yeast two hybrid screen indicated cypher binds with alpha-actinin (ACTN2), myotilin (MYOT), and calsarcin-1 (MYOZ2). Deletion of the last residue in both MYOT and MYOZ2 impaired binding with cypher.
evidence.rdfs:label: Yeast two hybrid screen with MYOZ2, MYOT, ACTN2

evidence.dc:description: Northern blot analysis revealed LDB3 is expressed in the heart and skeletal muscle. Western blot analysis was also consistent with this finding.
evidence.rdfs:label: Northern and Western Blot

evidence.dc:description: Protein Kinase C is not a definitively associated protein with DCM

Western blot analysis of immunoprecipitates of wild type or mutant Cypher (mouse model) along with HA-tagged Protein Kinase C (alpha, beta, and epsilon) showed wild type Cypher binds with protein kinase C.
evidence.rdfs:label: Pull down assay Protein Kinase C

evidence.dc:description: Co-immunoprecipitation showed binding between WT Cypher and ACTN2. Of note, the following variants in Cypher did not show any change in binding affinity with ACTN2 D117N, K136M, S189L, A165V, K204R/K251R, and R268C.
evidence.rdfs:label: Co-immunoprecipitation of ACTN2 with WT and variants

evidence.dc:description:
Coimmunoprecipitation followed by a Western blot confirmed Cypher interacts with ACTN2. Further investigation revealed it specifically binds to the PDZ domain: 

"To test whether the region of Cypher that interacts with α-actinin-2 is the PDZ domain, we made a series of deletion mutants of Cypher fused to GST. Assays in which GST fusion proteins were incubated with [35S]methionine-labeled α-actinin-2 showed that the 84-amino acid N-terminal PDZ domain bound to α-actinin-2. Other regions of Cypher did not bind to α-actinin-2 (Fig. 5 D)."
evidence.rdfs:label: Cypher PDZ domain interaction ACTN2

evidence.dc:description: PGM1 causes congenital disorders of glycosylation, not a non-syndromic DCM
Two yeast hybrid screen revealed PGM1 interacts with LDB3.
evidence.rdfs:label: Yeast two hybrid screen with PGM1

evidence.dc:description: Analysis of RNA expression for isoforms revealed cardiac and skeletal muscle specific isoforms. This was confirmed using Western blot.
evidence.rdfs:label: Cardiac and Skeletal specific isoforms

evidence.dc:description: Immunoprecipitation experiments showed ZASP is expressed in both fetal and adult hearts. Myosin was used as the control.
evidence.rdfs:label: Immunoprecipitation ZASP

evidence.dc:description: In situ hybridization revealed cypher is expressed in striated muscle tissues, including the myocardium, in mice embryos.
evidence.rdfs:label: Cypher expression in mice embryos

evidence.dc:description: Protein Kinase C is not a definitively associated protein with DCM
Yeast two hybrid assay and a pull down-assay.
evidence.rdfs:label: p.Asp626Asn and Protein Kinase C

evidence.dc:description: PGM1 is associated with congenital disorders of glycosylation, not a non-syndromic form of DCM
mammalian two-hybrid and co-immunoprecipitation assays showed reduced binding affinity.
evidence.rdfs:label: p.Ser189 and p.Thr206Ile impact binding to PGM1

evidence.dc:description: This was looked at in the context of stress-stimulation. Additionally, human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.

-KO mice developed an enlarged left ventricle in response to pressure-overload
-KO mice developed increased LV mass in response to isoproterenol
evidence.rdfs:label: Stress-induced dilated cardiomyopathy in young CypherL KO

evidence.dc:description: Rescue experimemnt does rescue a small percentage of mice with the long isoform knock-in and half of mice with short isoform knock-in. It uses a knock-in with Cypher null mice which is not as significant as if it had been mice with the missense variant. The authors used the skeletal isoform, not the cardiac isoform. There is limited information regarding the cardiac phenotype. All mice did still have cardiac fibrosis.

-80% of Cypher3sKI died by 4 weeks
-50% of Cypher2SKI died by 4 weeks
-Surviving mice all had growth retardation and abnormal striated muscle histology. Cardiac fibrosis was seen in both groups, more severe in group with Cyper3SKI
evidence.rdfs:label: Rescue Cypher null mice

evidence.dc:description: Human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.
The cardiomyopathy which developed in the mice was similar to humans--characterized by an enlarged LV with reduced systolic function. This lead to premature death.
evidence.rdfs:label: Deletion of Cypher Long Form leads to DCM in Mice

evidence.dc:description: Human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.

Knockout mice developed enlarged heart chambers with thinner chamber walls compared to controls. The mice progressed to develop heart failure and had reduced fractional shortening. They all passed away prematurely by 23 weeks of age.
evidence.rdfs:label: Knockout of Cardiac Specific Isoform Cypher

evidence.dc:description: Only the higher RNA dosage was noted to rescuse the "DCM" phenotype and only a portion of these embryos were rescued.

caudal regression and somite disorganization was rescued in up to 85% of zebrafish injected with the 10 ng RNA amount. 81% of these embryos had the pericardial enlargement rescued. Pericardial enlargement was not mentioned for the 5 ng amount.
evidence.rdfs:label: Rescue of the cypher knock-down phenotype in zebrafish

evidence.dc:description: Human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.
Knockout mice developed dilated left and right ventricles with abnormal histology consistent with DCM.
evidence.rdfs:label: Cypher KO mice

evidence.dc:description: This variant is very common in the general population (0.1% per gnomAD). The murine model is a transgenic rather than a better model utilizing knock-in or CRISPR to edit endogenous murine Ldb3. The level of overexpression was 4-6x normal.  Expert reviewers don’t believe that this is able to discern pathogenicity of this variant when produced in heterozygous people without TG overexpression.

By 10 months of age, mice with the p.S196L variant had developed cardiac dilation, reduced fractional shortening, and a reduced ejection fraction. Prior to developing signs of cardiomyopathy, the mice developed conduction delays and arrhythmias. They were determined to have abnormal sodium and calcium currents.
evidence.rdfs:label: S196L Mouse Model

evidence.dc:description: Human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.
Mice developed signs of dilated cardiomyopathy including dilated LV and RV chambers and reduced cardiac function.
evidence.rdfs:label: Inducible Cypher knockout mice

evidence.dc:description: The phenotype observed in the knockdown zebrafish is not a robust version of DCM. Additionally, human data has shown a heterozygous phenotype while this experimental data is only for knockout of both alleles.
The ventricular thinning seen in the zebrafish embryos was stated as the authors as a similar sign of dilated cardiomyopathy in humans as the ventricle also thins.
evidence.rdfs:label: Morpholino knockdown in zebrafish

evidence.dc:description: gnomAD population frequency 0.4% in East Asian and weak functional data
Functional data is regarding interaction with Protein Kinase C which isn't a definitive protein involved with DCM
high gnomAD frequency (1.6% in African and 1% Ashkenazi Jewish) also this variant was shown to not segregate with disease in two additional families in Levitas et al., 2016

in cells transfected with D117N-Cypher/ZASP, abnormal Cypher/ZASP and
actin staining were observed, with disarray of the actin cytoskeleton in both
Frequency in gnomAD in East Asian population 0.12%
Homozygous, no phenotypic data available on parents
Fetus was syndromic, heart showed hypertrophy, parents refused phenotyping, not AD pattern
RNA analysis demonstrated little/no expression of LDB3 protein with a functional C-terminal LIM domain in muscle tissue from the affected fetus."
Homozygous individual. No clinical information available on parents
There are only three affected individuals (all siblings) who had genetic testing and only two segregations.
evidence.rdfs:label: J7776

member.rdfs:label: II-6
member.previousTestingDescription: previous genetic testing for variants in dystrophin, cardiac actin, desmin, lamin A/C, cardiac myosin heavy chain, troponin T, tropomyosin, VCL, MLP, Tcap, and TTN.

member.rdfs:label: III.1
member.detectionMethod:
The proband and her sister had sequencing for TAZ, DTNA, SNTA1, FKBP1A, and
LDB3.

evidence.dc:description: There are a number of inconsistent segregations. Additionally, it appears to be a common variant in the Israeli population.
evidence.rdfs:label: Family A

member.rdfs:label: II.2
member.detectionMethod: Sequencing for the following genes: TAZ, DTNA, SNTA1, FKBP1A, and LDB3

evidence.dc:description: Candidate gene sequencing was used and as such we did not include this segregation data
evidence.rdfs:label: FDCM-066

member.rdfs:label: II.1
member.detectionMethod: Denaturing high performance liquid chromatography followed by sanger sequencing

evidence.dc:description: homozygous, unclear if parents underwent cardiac evaluations
Fetus was syndromic, heart showed hypertrophy, parents refused phenotyping, not AD pattern
RNA analysis demonstrated little/no expression of LDB3 protein with a functional C-terminal LIM domain in muscle tissue from the affected fetus."

caseCohort.detectionMethod: The exons of 24 genes closely associated with familial DCM (ABCC9, ACTC1, ACTN2, DES, LAMA4, LDB3, LMNA, MYBPC3, MYH6, MYH7, MYPN, PLN, PSEN1, PSEN2, RBM20, SCN5A, SGCD, TAZ, TCAP, TMPO, TNNI3, TNNT2, TPM1, and VCL) were sequenced using targeted next-generation sequencing method

controlCohort.detectionMethod: The sequencing data of the 197 Chinese adults deposited in the 1000 Genomes Project database were used as the Chinese (ethnic-matched) control group in this study.

evidence.dc:description: High gnomAD frequency (0.4% East Asian) and weak functional data
Protein interaction with Protein Kinase C (yeast two hybrid screen)
Not clear any other genes were analyzed beyond LDB3 for this cohort
high gnomAD frequency and variant shown not to segregate with disease in two additional large families (Levitas et al., 2016)

in cells transfected
with D117N-Cypher/ZASP, abnormal Cypher/ZASP and
actin staining were observed, with disarray of the actin
cytoskeleton in both
LDB3 was the only gene sequenced, allele frequency 0.1% European Finnish population
mouse model showed dilated LV and reduced EF (From Li et al. 2010)
Individual is homozygous. No clinical information about parents who are carriers.
High population frequency per gnomAD (0.4%), weak functional evidence
Functional data indicates interferes with binding with Protein Kinase C
